name: Analysis Purpose
definition: Exploratory measures that will be used to evaluate the intervention(s) or, for observational studies, that are exploratory of the study.

name: Analysis Purpose
definition: The primary measurement(s) or observation(s) used to measure the effect of experimental variables in a study, or for observational studies, to describe patterns of diseases or traits or associations with exposures, risk factors or treatment. These are the outcome measures used to assess the primary objective(s).

name: Analysis Purpose
definition: Secondary measures that will be used to evaluate the intervention(s) or, for observational studies, that are a focus of the study. These are the outcome measures used to assess the secondary objective(s).

name: Analysis Reason
definition: The analysis was triggered by findings in the data.

name: Analysis Reason
definition: The analysis has been requested by a regulatory agency.

name: Analysis Reason
definition: The analysis is specified in a protocol.

name: Analysis Reason
definition: The analysis is specified in a statistical analysis plan.
term: Analysis Specified in Statistical Analysis Plan

name: Date Imputation Flag
definition: Day Imputed: Day is imputed.

name: Date Imputation Flag
definition: Month Imputed: Month and day are imputed.

name: Date Imputation Flag
definition: Year Imputed: Entire date (year, month and day) is imputed.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Average: A data derivation technique which calculates a subject's average value over a defined set of records.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Best Case: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the best possible outcome.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Baseline Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's nonmissing baseline observation.
term: Baseline Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Best Observed Case: A data imputation technique which populates analysis values with the best outcome recorded within a subject.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Best Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's previous best-case nonmissing value.
term: Best Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Endpoint: A data derivation technique which populates a subject's analysis end point value.

name: Derivation Type
definition: A method of imputation involving populating an analysis value that is outside the range of observed values and is estimated by a function of those observed values.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Interpolation: A method of imputation involving a missing value that is between known values and is estimated by a function of those known values.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Last Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's previous nonmissing value.
term: Last Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Last Observed Value: A data imputation technique which populates analysis values with the subject's last recorded nonmissing observation.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Last Value Prior to Dosing: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's last observed value prior to the start of study treatment.
term: Last Value Prior to Dosing Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Maximum: A technique which populates an analysis value with a subject's maximum value over a defined set of records.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Minimum: A technique which populates an analysis value with a subject's minimum value over a defined set of records.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Maximum Likelihood: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with estimates that maximize the probability of observing what has in fact been observed.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Mean of Other Group: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the mean value from a comparator or reference group.
term: Mean of Other Group Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Mean Observed Value in a Group: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the mean value observed in a group of subjects.
term: Mean Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's next-to-last nonmissing value.
term: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Screening Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's nonmissing screening observation.
term: Screening Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Worst Case: A data imputation technique which populates analysis values with the worst possible outcome.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Worst Observed Case: A data imputation technique which populates analysis values with the worst recorded outcome within a subject.

name: Derivation Type
definition: Worst Observed Value Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's worst-case nonmissing observation.
term: Worst Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: Worst Observed Value in a Group: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the worst value observed in a group of subjects.
term: Worst Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

name: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Code
definition: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total score.
term: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total Score

name: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Name
definition: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total score.
term: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total Score

name: Parameter Type
definition: Derived: Indicates that a parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.

name: Subject Trial Status
definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)

name: Subject Trial Status
definition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

name: Subject Trial Status
definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption. (NCI)

name: Time Imputation Flag
definition: Hours Imputed: Entire time (hours, minutes and seconds) is imputed.

name: Time Imputation Flag
definition: Minutes Imputed: Minutes and seconds are imputed.

name: Time Imputation Flag
definition: Seconds Imputed: Seconds are imputed.
